page.title: 10THE CHURCHES
page.content: The churches at Buxton and at Lammas will be described here. It is interesting to note that the two churches, which are about a mile apart, are both dedicated to St. Andrew. They come under the charge of the Revd. Frank Richard Knight Hare M.A. Both churches are built of flint with limestone cornering and are in good repair. They have only morning services and both have family services once a month. Both churches date from the 13th century. Both churches have their own Wardens and Parochial Church Councils. Buxton Church is in the centre of the village whilst Lammas Church is rather seperate standing across a meadow and beautifully placed on the banks of the River Bure.
